results.question: The Spitfire originated from a racing plane.
"I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it" is a quote from French philosopher Voltaire.
United States President John F. Kennedy was assassinated during his presidential motorcade in Atlanta, Georgia on November 22nd, 1963.
The United States of America declared their independence from the British Empire on July 4th, 1776.
Adolf Hitler was tried at the Nuremberg trials.
Kublai Khan is the grandchild of Genghis Khan?
During the Winter War, the amount of Soviet Union soliders that died or went missing was five times more than Finland's.
The French Kingdom helped the United States gain their independence over Great Britain during the Revolutionary War.
Sir Issac Newton served as a Member of Parliament, but the only recorded time he spoke was to complain about a draft in the chambers.
The man that shot Alexander Hamilton was named Aaron Burr.
